title: 14-year-old UK fan writes letters to recruit Alkins, top prospects
text:
Looks like John Calipari might have some help in luring the top recruits to the University of Kentucky.
A 14-year-old Kentucky fan has sent personalized letters to six of the top Wildcats recruits to provide his reasons as to why the player should come to Lexington. He wrote two weeks ago to five-star recruit Rawle Alkins, and Alkins posted the letter on Twitter on Friday.
Preston Carter, from Hustonville, Ky., said he was inspired after Kentucky’s loss to Wisconsin in the Final Four to “make sure that UK didn’t lose another opportunity to win a national title.” Over the summer, he looked up the top Kentucky prospects on a recruiting website, Googled the addresses of their schools, put the player’s name and the school’s name on the envelope and mailed them.
Alkins’ letter came later after he transferred from Christ The King in New York to Word of God in North Carolina.
Alkins’ tweet with the letter included the message, “UK fans are serious I Love it !”
UK fans are serious I Love it ! pic.twitter.com/ZKVtzywTkC
— Rawle Alkins (@Iam_RawleAlkins) October 23, 2015 The letter to Alkins is dated Oct. 13 and 7:07 p.m. and begins “Dear Rawle” with the word “King” written in above. He ended the letter with, “I hope to see you in a Kentucky uniform.”
Next to his name at the bottom, Carter affixed a sticker with the UK logo.
Carter’s reasoning for Alkins to come to UK was because of Calipari’s success with great guards and getting them to the NBA.
Carter also got a response via Instagram from Sacha-Killeya Jones, a power forward from Chapel Hill, N.C., who committed to Kentucky in August.
Carter has been a UK fan his entire life and his mom, Sandi, said he has been “playing basketball since he could grip a ball.” He just made his high school team this week.
“I was a bit skeptical when he told me what he was doing, but he said he thought it would help the Big Blue Nation,” she said. “When he gets his mind set on something, I know better than to doubt and I guess he was right.”
Preston said he really believed the players would see the letters.
“Preston really does bleed blue,” Sandi said. ” He would love to meet Coach Cal one day.”
